resources.string: This application aims to create a unified internet quick-settings tile, which is actually useful (I\'m looking at you, Android 12).
Tapping the internet tile will simply toggle between Wi-Fi and mobile data. Separate Wi-Fi and mobile data tiles are also available if you just want to go back to how it was before Android 12.
Unfortunately, root access is required to enable/disable Wi-Fi and mobile data, as well as for reading the SSID of the current Wi-Fi network.
If enabled, you will need to unlock your device first before being able to toggle between internet modes.
Shizuku access is needed to enable/disable Wi-Fi and mobile data, as well as reading your Wi-Fi network name.
This permission is used to read your mobile data connection type (2G, 3G, 4G, 5G). This is optional.

If a tile still tells you that it does not have root access, even after granting, you can try force closing the app. This will cause a new process to be created and the root permission to be rechecked.
Go into the application settings and grant this permission manually.

You need Shizuku version 11 or higher to use this app. Make sure you\'ve installed the Shizuku app and Shizuku is running. If Shizuku is running, make sure you\'ve granted permission to this app to use it. https://shizuku.rikka.app
